</code></pre>
<p>çµæœå¦‚åœ–:</p>
<p><img src="http://i.imgur.com/hliw73q.png" alt="pic"></p>
<p>çµæœæœç„¶å¦‚æˆ‘æ‰€æƒ³ä¸€æ¨£ :) ç•¶ç„¶traitsæˆ‘ç¾åœ¨å…¶å¯¦ä¹Ÿä¸æ˜¯å®Œå…¨å¾ˆç­å•¦ï¼Œç•¢ç«Ÿå‰›çœ‹æ²’å¤šä¹…ï¼Œå¦å¤–æ²’æƒ³åˆ°C++ 11 ç«Ÿç„¶æ”¯æ´ classåœ¨å®£å‘Šè³‡æ–™çš„åŒæ™‚ä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥é€²è¡Œinitializeï¼Œåš‡åˆ°æˆ‘äº†! çœ‹ä¾†åœ¨æˆ‘æ²’ç”¨C++çš„æ™‚æœŸï¼ŒC++æ”¹è®Šäº†å¾ˆå¤šé˜¿!!! çœŸçš„è¦æ‰¾æ™‚é–“å¥½å¥½é‡æ–°èªè­˜C++äº† :)</p>f5:T90d,<p>çœŸçš„å¥½æ„Ÿæ…¨å•Š!! æƒ³æƒ³ä»¥å‰ç”¨windows apiå»å¯«ç›¸åŒçš„ç¨‹å¼ï¼Œå°±è¦å¤šå¾ˆå¤šå·¥å¤«ï¼Œå¾ˆå¤šåº•å±¤çš„æ±è¥¿éƒ½è¦è‡ªå·±å¯¦åšï¼Œç”¨åˆ¥äººå¹«ä½ å»ºæ§‹å¥½çš„æ¶æ§‹å°±æ˜¯å¿«é€Ÿç°¡å–®é˜¿ :)</p>
<pre><code class="hljs language-python">	<span class="hljs-keyword">from</span> tkinter <span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> *  
	<span class="hljs-keyword">from</span> tkinter <span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> ttk  
	  
	  
	<span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">main</span>():  
	 lasty, lastx = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>, <span class="hljs-number">0</span>  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">xy</span>(<span class="hljs-params">event</span>):  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">nonlocal</span> lasty, lastx  
	 lastx = event.x  
	 lasty = event.y  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">addLine</span>(<span class="hljs-params">event</span>):  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">nonlocal</span> lasty, lastx  
	 canvas.create_line((lastx, lasty, event.x, event.y))  
	 lasty = event.y  
	 lastx = event.x  
	  
	  
	 root = Tk()  
	 root.columnconfigure(<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, weight=<span class="hljs-number">1</span>)  
	 root.rowconfigure(<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, weight=<span class="hljs-number">1</span>)  
	  
	 canvas = Canvas(root)  
	 canvas.grid(column=<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, row=<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, sticky=<span class="hljs-string">'nwes'</span>)  
	 canvas.bind(<span class="hljs-string">'&amp;ltButton-1&amp;gt'</span>, xy)  
	 canvas.bind(<span class="hljs-string">'&amp;ltB1-Motion&amp;gt'</span>, addLine)  
	 root.mainloop()  
	  
	  
	<span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> __name__ == <span class="hljs-string">'__main__'</span>:  
	 main()  
</code></pre>
<p>é€™æ¨£çŸ­çŸ­çš„codeå°±å¯¦åšå‡ºä¾†äº†ã€‚ æˆæœå¦‚åœ–æ¡ˆæ‰€ç¤º(æ©é¢ï¼Œç”¨æ»‘é¼ å¯«å­—å¥½é›£ :( )</p>
<p><img src="http://i.imgur.com/H3ulIXE.png" alt="pic"></p>
<p>å…¶å¯¦é€™æ¬¡æœƒPOé€™ç¯‡ï¼Œæ˜¯æƒ³è¦åšå€‹è¨˜éŒ„:) é ­ä¸€æ¬¡ç”¨åˆ°nonlocal = =ï¼Œé€™æ˜¯ç”¨ä¾†å–çš„æœ€è¿‘çš„ä¸Šå±¤scopeçš„è®Šæ•¸ï¼Œå› æ­¤æˆ‘åœ¨ xyå‡½å¼è£¡é¢å¯«äº† nonlocal lastx, lasty æ˜¯ç‚ºäº†å–å¾— mainå‡½å¼çš„ lastx, lastyçš„referenceï¼Œè®“æˆ‘å¯ä»¥éš¨æ„æ”¹è®Šä»–å€‘çš„å€¼</p>f6:T6086,<p>ç¹¼çºŒä¹‹å‰ä½¿ç”¨ctypeså¯¦åšWindows data typeï¼Œé€™æ¬¡è¦åšçš„æ˜¯ä½¿ç”¨windows apiï¼Œä¾†åšä¸€å€‹console interfaceçš„èŠå¤©å®¤ï¼Œæ­¤ç¯‡åƒ…å…ˆåšå‡ºä»‹é¢çš„æ¨£å­</p>
<pre><code class="hljs language-python">	<span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> ctypes  
	<span class="hljs-keyword">from</span> ctypes <span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> wintypes  
	<span class="hljs-keyword">from</span> ctypes.wintypes <span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> *  
	<span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> msvcrt  
	<span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> sys  
	  
	<span class="hljs-comment">#-----------------debug use----------------------  </span>
	<span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> inspect  
	  
	<span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">myDebugMsg</span>(<span class="hljs-params">msg=<span class="hljs-string">''</span></span>):  
	 <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(<span class="hljs-string">'{} at:{}'</span>.<span class="hljs-built_in">format</span>(msg, inspect.stack()[<span class="hljs-number">1</span>][<span class="hljs-number">1</span>:<span class="hljs-number">3</span>]))  
	  
	<span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">pause</span>():  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">while</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>:  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> msvcrt.kbhit():  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">break</span>  
	<span class="hljs-comment">#------------------------------------------------  </span>
	  
	  
	<span class="hljs-comment">#--------------------------------------------------  </span>
	<span class="hljs-comment"># use ctypes to create a windows data type  </span>
	<span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">Char</span>(ctypes.<span class="hljs-type">Union</span>):  
	 _fields_ = [(<span class="hljs-string">"UnicodeChar"</span>,WCHAR),  
	 (<span class="hljs-string">"AsciiChar"</span>, CHAR)]  
	  
	<span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">CHAR_INFO</span>(ctypes.Structure):  
	 _anonymous_ = (<span class="hljs-string">"Char"</span>,)  
	 _fields_ = [(<span class="hljs-string">"Char"</span>, Char),  
	 (<span class="hljs-string">"Attributes"</span>, WORD)]  
	  
	  
	<span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">CONSOLE_CURSOR_INFO</span>(ctypes.Structure):  
	 _fields_ = [(<span class="hljs-string">'dwSize'</span>, DWORD),  
	 (<span class="hljs-string">'bVisible'</span>, BOOL)]  
	  
	  
	PCHAR_INFO = ctypes.POINTER(CHAR_INFO)  
	COORD = wintypes._COORD  
	<span class="hljs-comment">#---------------------------------------------------  </span>
	  
	  
	<span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">dllLoader</span>:  
	 <span class="hljs-string">'''  
	 load the dll written by c and call them for use   
	 '''</span>  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">__init__</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self</span>):  
	 self.mKernel32 = ctypes.WinDLL(<span class="hljs-string">'Kernel32.dll'</span>)  
	 self.mUser32 = ctypes.WinDLL(<span class="hljs-string">'User32.dll'</span>)  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">getKernel32</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self</span>):  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> self.mKernel32  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">getUser32</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self</span>):  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> self.mUser32  
	  
	 Kernel32 = <span class="hljs-built_in">property</span>(getKernel32)  
	 User32 = <span class="hljs-built_in">property</span>(getUser32)  
	  
	  
	dll = dllLoader()  
</code></pre>
<p>ä¸Šé¢é€™äº›codeæ˜¯å…ˆå°‡æˆ‘æœƒç”¨åˆ°çš„dllæª”å…ˆloadå¥½å’Œwindows api data typeå¯¦åšå‡ºä¾†ï¼Œå¦å¤–é‚„æœ‰æ–¹ä¾¿æˆ‘ç”¨ä¾†debugçš„å‡½å¼ï¼Œæ¥ä¸‹ä¾†å°±æ˜¯ç”¨ä¾†å¯¦åšä»‹é¢çš„code</p>
<pre><code class="hljs language-python">	<span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">consoleBackBuffer</span>:  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">__init__</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, w, h</span>):  
	 self.mstdout = dll.Kernel32.CreateConsoleScreenBuffer(  
	 <span class="hljs-number">0x80000000</span>|<span class="hljs-number">0x40000000</span>, <span class="hljs-comment">#generic read and write  </span>
	 <span class="hljs-number">0x00000001</span>|<span class="hljs-number">0x00000002</span>,  
	 <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>,  
	 <span class="hljs-number">1</span>, <span class="hljs-comment">#CONSOLE_TEXTMODE_BUFFER defined in winbase.h  </span>
	 <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> self.mstdout == HANDLE(-<span class="hljs-number">1</span>):  
	 myDebugMsg(<span class="hljs-string">'CreateConsoleScreenBuffer failed'</span>)  
	  
	  
	 self.cursorInfo = CONSOLE_CURSOR_INFO()  
	 self.cursorInfo.dwSize = <span class="hljs-number">25</span>  
	  
	  
	 self.coordBufSize = COORD()  
	 self.coordBufSize.X = w  
	 self.coordBufSize.Y = h  
	  
	 self.coordBufCoord = COORD()  
	 self.coordBufCoord.X = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>  
	 self.coordBufCoord.y = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>  
	  
	  
	 self.readRgn = SMALL_RECT()  
	 self.readRgn.Top = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>  
	 self.readRgn.Left = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>  
	 self.readRgn.Right = w-<span class="hljs-number">1</span>  
	 self.readRgn.Bottom = h-<span class="hljs-number">1</span>  
	  
	  
	 self.writeRgn = SMALL_RECT()  
	 self.writeRgn.Top = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>  
	 self.writeRgn.Left = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>  
	 self.writeRgn.Right = <span class="hljs-number">79</span>  
	 self.writeRgn.Bottom = <span class="hljs-number">24</span>  
	  
	 self.actuallyWritten = DWORD() <span class="hljs-comment"># used when writeconsole called  </span>
	  
	 self.setCursorVisibility() <span class="hljs-comment"># by default, set cursor invisible  </span>
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">setCursorVisibility</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, flag = <span class="hljs-literal">False</span></span>):  
	 self.cursorInfo.bVisible = flag  
	 dll.Kernel32.SetConsoleCursorInfo(self.mstdout, ctypes.byref(self.cursorInfo))  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">toggleActiveConsole</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, stdout=<span class="hljs-literal">None</span></span>):  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> stdout != <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>:  
	 dll.Kernel32.SetConsoleActiveScreenBuffer(stdout)  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">else</span>:  
	 dll.Kernel32.SetConsoleActiveScreenBuffer(self.mstdout)  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">getHandle</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self</span>):  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> self.mstdout  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">set_color</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, color</span>):  
	 dll.Kernel32.SetConsoleTextAttribute( self.mstdout, color )  
	  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">gotoxy</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, x, y, stdout=<span class="hljs-literal">None</span></span>):  
	 coord = COORD(x, y)  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> stdout == <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>:  
	 dll.Kernel32.SetConsoleCursorPosition( self.mstdout, coord)  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">else</span>:  
	 dll.Kernel32.SetConsoleCursorPosition( stdout, coord)  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">setWriteSrc</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, x, y</span>):  
	 self.writeRgn.Top = y  
	 self.writeRgn.Left = x  
	 self.writeRgn.Right = x+self.coordBufSize.X-<span class="hljs-number">1</span>  
	 self.writeRgn.Bottom = y+self.coordBufSize.Y-<span class="hljs-number">1</span>  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">write</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, msg</span>):  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">while</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">len</span>(msg)&gt;self.coordBufSize.X:  
	  
	 tempMsg = msg[:self.coordBufSize.X-<span class="hljs-number">1</span>]+<span class="hljs-string">'\n'</span>  
	 msg = msg[self.coordBufSize.X-<span class="hljs-number">1</span>:]  
	  
	 success = dll.Kernel32.WriteConsoleW(  
	 self.mstdout,  
	 tempMsg,  
	 DWORD(<span class="hljs-built_in">len</span>(tempMsg)),  
	 ctypes.byref(self.actuallyWritten),  
	 <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> success == <span class="hljs-number">0</span>:  
	 myDebugMsg(<span class="hljs-string">'WriteConsoleW failed'</span>)  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> <span class="hljs-string">'\n'</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">not</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> msg:  
	 msg = msg+<span class="hljs-string">'\n'</span>  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">len</span>(msg) != <span class="hljs-number">0</span>:  
	 success = dll.Kernel32.WriteConsoleW(  
	 self.mstdout,  
	 msg,  
	 DWORD(<span class="hljs-built_in">len</span>(msg)),  
	 ctypes.byref(self.actuallyWritten),  
	 <span class="hljs-literal">None</span>)  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> success == <span class="hljs-number">0</span>:  
	 myDebugMsg(<span class="hljs-string">'WriteConsoleW failed'</span>)  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">present</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, mainBuffer</span>):  
	 chiBuffer = (CHAR_INFO*(self.coordBufSize.X*self.coordBufSize.Y))()  
	  
	 success = dll.Kernel32.ReadConsoleOutputW(  
	 self.mstdout,  
	 ctypes.byref(chiBuffer),  
	 self.coordBufSize,  
	 self.coordBufCoord,  
	 ctypes.byref(self.readRgn)  
	 )  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> success == <span class="hljs-number">0</span>:  
	 myDebugMsg(<span class="hljs-string">'ReadConsoleOutputW failed'</span>)  
	  
	 success = dll.Kernel32.WriteConsoleOutputW(  
	 mainBuffer,  
	 ctypes.byref(chiBuffer),  
	 self.coordBufSize,  
	 self.coordBufCoord,  
	 ctypes.byref(self.writeRgn))  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> success == <span class="hljs-number">0</span>:  
	 myDebugMsg(<span class="hljs-string">'WriteConsoleOutput failed'</span>)  
</code></pre>
<p>æˆ‘æœƒå¯¦åšä¸€å€‹console bufferçš„åŸå› æ˜¯ï¼Œæˆ‘æƒ³è¦ç”¨double bufferï¼Œç•¢ç«Ÿç•«é¢éœ€è¦å¸¸å¸¸æ›´æ–°ï¼Œç‚ºäº†ä¸è®“ç•«é¢æœ‰é–ƒçˆï¼Œå› æ­¤ä½¿ç”¨é€™å€‹æŠ€è¡“ã€‚é¡Œå¤–è©±ï¼Œå…¶å¯¦æ„Ÿè¦ºæ»¿æ–°é®®çš„ :) å› ç‚ºæˆ‘ä»¥å‰ç”¨édouble bufferæ˜¯åœ¨ä½¿ç”¨ windows apiçš„gdiæ‰ç”¨éï¼Œæœç„¶åœ¨CLIè£¡ä¹Ÿæœ‰ :) è¦ªè‡ªå¯¦åšçš„æ„Ÿè¦ºï¼Œå…¶å¯¦æ»¿æœ‰æˆå°±æ„Ÿçš„ï¼Œæ¥ä¸‹ä¾†å°±æ˜¯åšä¸€äº› widgetå‡ºä¾†ï¼Œåªæ˜¯æˆ‘å°æ–¼GUIçš„å…ƒä»¶è©²æœ‰æ€æ¨£çš„åŒ…è£ï¼Œæˆ‘ä¹Ÿä¸æ¸…æ¥šï¼Œå› æ­¤åªæ˜¯éš¨æ„çš„åšåšè€Œå·² :(</p>
<pre><code class="hljs language-python">	<span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">widget</span>:  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">__init__</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, sx, sy, w, h</span>):  
	 self.console = consoleBackBuffer(w, h)  
	 self.console.setWriteSrc(sx, sy)  
	 self.gx = sx  
	 self.gy = sy  
	 <span class="hljs-comment">#global position  </span>
	 self.w = w  
	 self.h = h  
	 self.mTitle = <span class="hljs-string">'no name'</span>  
	 self.content = []  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">getConsole</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self</span>):  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> self.console  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">getContent</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self</span>):  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> self.content[:]  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">setContent</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, content</span>):  
	 self.content = content[:]  
	  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">setTitle</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, title</span>):  
	 self.mTitle = title  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">getTitle</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self</span>):  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> self.mTitle  
	  
	 title = <span class="hljs-built_in">property</span>(getTitle, setTitle)  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">addContent</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, s</span>):  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">len</span>(s) &gt;= self.w-<span class="hljs-number">3</span>:  
	 self.content.append(s[:self.w-<span class="hljs-number">3</span>])  
	 self.content.append(s[self.w-<span class="hljs-number">3</span>:])  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">else</span>:  
	 self.content.append(s)  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">delContent</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, s</span>):  
	 self.content.remove(s)  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">display</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, stdout</span>):  
	 self.console.present(stdout)  
	  
	  
	<span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">usermenu</span>(<span class="hljs-title class_ inherited__">widget</span>):  
	 <span class="hljs-string">'''  
	 show user list  
	 '''</span>  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">__init__</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, sx, sy, w, h</span>):  
	 <span class="hljs-built_in">super</span>().__init__(sx, sy, w, h)  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">update</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self</span>):  
	 <span class="hljs-comment">#draw outline  </span>
	 border = <span class="hljs-string">'|'</span>+<span class="hljs-string">'-'</span>*(self.w-<span class="hljs-number">2</span>)+<span class="hljs-string">'|'</span>  
	 emptyLine = <span class="hljs-string">'|'</span>+<span class="hljs-string">' '</span>*(self.w-<span class="hljs-number">2</span>)+<span class="hljs-string">'|'</span>  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> y <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">range</span>(self.h):  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> y <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> (<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, <span class="hljs-number">2</span>, self.h-<span class="hljs-number">1</span>):  
	 self.console.write(border)  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">else</span>:  
	 self.console.write(emptyLine)  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-comment">#draw title and user list  </span>
	 tx = <span class="hljs-built_in">int</span>( (self.w - <span class="hljs-built_in">len</span>(self.title))/<span class="hljs-number">2</span> )  
	 self.console.gotoxy(tx, <span class="hljs-number">1</span>)  
	 self.console.write(self.title)  
	  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> i <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">range</span>(<span class="hljs-built_in">len</span>(self.content)):  
	 self.console.gotoxy(<span class="hljs-number">2</span>, <span class="hljs-number">3</span>+i)  
	 self.console.write(self.content[i])  
	 self.console.gotoxy(<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, <span class="hljs-number">0</span>)  
	  
	  
	<span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">msgroom</span>(<span class="hljs-title class_ inherited__">widget</span>):  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">__init__</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, sx, sy, w, h</span>):  
	 <span class="hljs-built_in">super</span>().__init__(sx, sy, w, h)  
	 self.scroll = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>  
	 self.start = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">scrollContent</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, offset</span>):  
	 self.scroll += offset  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> self.scroll &gt; <span class="hljs-number">0</span>:  
	 self.scroll = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">detectPageUpAndDown</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self</span>):  
	 pageUP = dll.User32.GetAsyncKeyState(<span class="hljs-number">0x21</span>)  
	 pageDown = dll.User32.GetAsyncKeyState(<span class="hljs-number">0x22</span>)  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> pageUP != <span class="hljs-number">0</span>:  
	 self.scrollContent(-<span class="hljs-number">2</span>)  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> pageDown != <span class="hljs-number">0</span>:  
	 self.scrollContent(<span class="hljs-number">2</span>)  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">update</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self</span>):  
	 self.detectPageUpAndDown()  
	 border = <span class="hljs-string">'|'</span>+<span class="hljs-string">'-'</span>*(self.w-<span class="hljs-number">2</span>)+<span class="hljs-string">'|'</span>  
	 emptyLine = <span class="hljs-string">'|'</span>+<span class="hljs-string">' '</span>*(self.w-<span class="hljs-number">2</span>)+<span class="hljs-string">'|'</span>  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> y <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">range</span>(self.h):  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> y <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> (<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, <span class="hljs-number">2</span>, self.h-<span class="hljs-number">1</span>):  
	 self.console.write(border)  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">else</span>:  
	 self.console.write(emptyLine)  
	 <span class="hljs-comment">#draw title and content  </span>
	 tx = <span class="hljs-built_in">int</span>( (self.w - <span class="hljs-built_in">len</span>(self.title))/<span class="hljs-number">2</span> )  
	 self.console.gotoxy(tx, <span class="hljs-number">1</span>)  
	 self.console.write(self.title)  
	  
	 index = <span class="hljs-built_in">len</span>(self.content)-(self.h-<span class="hljs-number">4</span>)+self.scroll  
	 self.start = <span class="hljs-number">0</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> index &lt; <span class="hljs-number">0</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">else</span> index  
	  
	 obj = self.content <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">len</span>(self.content) &lt; self.h-<span class="hljs-number">4</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">else</span> self.content[self.start : self.start+self.h-<span class="hljs-number">4</span>]  
	 <span class="hljs-comment"># wow, slice in python seems to automatically check the index if it is out of range  </span>
	 <span class="hljs-comment"># ex. lst = [1,2,3,4,5]  </span>
	 <span class="hljs-comment"># lst[-6:] no error produce  </span>
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> i <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">range</span>(<span class="hljs-built_in">len</span>(obj)):  
	 self.console.gotoxy(<span class="hljs-number">1</span>, <span class="hljs-number">3</span>+i)  
	 self.console.write(obj[i])  
	 self.console.gotoxy(<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, <span class="hljs-number">0</span>)  
	  
	  
	  
	<span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">inputLabel</span>(<span class="hljs-title class_ inherited__">widget</span>):  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">__init__</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self, sx, sy, w, h</span>):  
	 <span class="hljs-built_in">super</span>().__init__(sx, sy, w, h)  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">update</span>(<span class="hljs-params">self</span>):  
	 border = <span class="hljs-string">'|'</span>+<span class="hljs-string">'-'</span>*(self.w-<span class="hljs-number">2</span>)+<span class="hljs-string">'|'</span>  
	 emptyLine = <span class="hljs-string">'|'</span>+<span class="hljs-string">' '</span>*(self.w-<span class="hljs-number">2</span>)+<span class="hljs-string">'|'</span>  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> y <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">range</span>(self.h):  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> y <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> (<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, <span class="hljs-number">2</span>, self.h-<span class="hljs-number">1</span>):  
	 self.console.write(border)  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">else</span>:  
	 self.console.write(emptyLine)  
	  
	 tx = <span class="hljs-built_in">int</span>( (self.w - <span class="hljs-number">8</span>))  
	 self.console.gotoxy(tx, <span class="hljs-number">0</span>)  
	 self.console.write(<span class="hljs-string">'|'</span>)  
	 self.console.gotoxy(tx, <span class="hljs-number">2</span>)  
	 self.console.write(<span class="hljs-string">'|'</span>)  
	 self.console.gotoxy(tx, <span class="hljs-number">1</span>)  
	 self.console.write(<span class="hljs-string">'|submit'</span>)  
	 self.console.gotoxy(<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, <span class="hljs-number">0</span>)
</code></pre>
<pre><code>å¥½äº†åˆ°é€™é‚Šç‚ºæ­¢ä»»å‹™å°±å®Œæˆäº†ï¼Œæƒ³ç•¶ç„¶çˆ¾ï¼Œè¦å¯«å€‹codeä¾†æ¸¬è©¦ï¼Œè‡ªå·±å¯«å‡ºä¾†çš„codeæ˜¯ä¸æ˜¯è·Ÿè‡ªå·±æƒ³çš„æ•ˆæœä¸€æ¨£
</code></pre>
<pre><code class="hljs language-python">	<span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">test</span>():  
	 <span class="hljs-string">'''   
	 like this?  
	 in windows, the size of console is 80X25 by default   
	  
	 setting:   
	 2 space for left and rigth edge  
	 one space or \n for each panel  
	  
	 chatroom: 15 height, 55 width  
	 user list: 16 height, 15 width  
	 submit: 71 width, height 3  
	 |-------------------------------------------------------------| |-----------|  
	 | chatroom | | user list |  
	 |-------------------------------------------------------------| |-----------|  
	 |name2: hello, you | |df |  
	 |name1: yo | |yeah |  
	 | | |one |  
	 | | | |  
	 | | | |  
	 |-------------------------------------------------------------| |-----------|  
	  
	 |-------------------------------------------------------------------|-------|  
	 | yo, hahaha |submit |  
	 |-------------------------------------------------------------------|-------|  
	  
	 '''</span>  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">from</span> threading <span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> Timer, Thread  
	  
	  
	 hstdout = dll.Kernel32.GetStdHandle(DWORD(-<span class="hljs-number">11</span>))  
	  
	 <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span>(hstdout == HANDLE(-<span class="hljs-number">1</span>)):  
	 <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(<span class="hljs-string">'create buffer failed'</span>)  
	  
	 backBuffer = consoleBackBuffer(<span class="hljs-number">80</span>, <span class="hljs-number">25</span>)  
	  
	 userpanel = usermenu(<span class="hljs-number">56</span>, <span class="hljs-number">0</span>, <span class="hljs-number">15</span>, <span class="hljs-number">17</span>)  
	 userpanel.title = <span class="hljs-string">'user list'</span>  
	 userpanel.addContent(<span class="hljs-string">'heyhey'</span>)  
	 userpanel.addContent(<span class="hljs-string">'haha'</span>)  
	 userpanel.update()  
	 userpanel.display(backBuffer.getHandle())  
	  
	 chatroom = msgroom(<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, <span class="hljs-number">0</span>, <span class="hljs-number">55</span>, <span class="hljs-number">17</span>)  
	 chatroom.title = <span class="hljs-string">'chat room'</span>  
	 chatroom.addContent(<span class="hljs-string">"eric: I'm so happy"</span>)  
	 chatroom.update()  
	 chatroom.display(backBuffer.getHandle())  
	  
	 inLabel = inputLabel(<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, <span class="hljs-number">18</span>, <span class="hljs-number">71</span>, <span class="hljs-number">3</span>)  
	 inLabel.update()  
	 inLabel.display(backBuffer.getHandle())  
	  
	 backBuffer.present(hstdout)  
	 <span class="hljs-built_in">input</span>()  
	  
	  
	  
	<span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> __name__ == <span class="hljs-string">'__main__'</span>:  
	 test()  
</code></pre>
<p>çµæœè·‘å‡ºä¾†çš„ï¼Œå¦‚åŒæˆ‘æƒ³åƒ happy :)<br>
å…¶å¯¦å¾Œä¾†æˆ‘æœ‰ä½¿ç”¨socketï¼Œthreadæ¨¡çµ„ï¼ŒåŠ ä¸Šé€™ç¯‡å¯«çš„codeå¯¦åšå‡ºä¸€å€‹å¤šäººèŠå¤©å®¤ï¼Œåªæ˜¯æ„Ÿè¦ºé³¥é³¥çš„ï¼Œæœ‰é»ä¸æƒ³POå‡ºä¾† :( ï¼Œæœ€è¿‘æ˜¯æ‰“ç®—å¯«å‡ºä¸€å€‹èŠå¤©è»Ÿé«”æ˜¯GUIä»‹é¢çš„ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥è¦å…ˆä¾†ç ”ç©¶tkinterï¼Œå¸Œæœ›èƒ½å¤ æˆåŠŸåšå‡ºä¾†ã€‚</p>f7:T1e95,<p>æœ€è¿‘æƒ³è¦ç”¨pythonå¯«å€‹GUIçš„èŠå¤©è»Ÿé«”ï¼Œæ–¼æ˜¯åœ¨ç¶²è·¯ä¸ŠæŸ¥äº†ä¸€äº›è³‡æ–™ï¼Œä¼¼ä¹pyQTæ»¿å—æ­¡è¿çš„ï¼Œåªæ˜¯æœ¬äººæˆ‘ä¸€ç›´ä»¥ä¾†æœ‰å€‹æ¯›ç—…ï¼Œå°±æ˜¯ä¸å–œæ­¡åœ¨é›»è…¦è£æ±è£è¥¿çš„ :) å› æ­¤æ±ºå®šä½¿ç”¨pythonæ¨™æº–åº«è£¡é¢çš„tkinterï¼Œåªæ˜¯å‰›é–‹å§‹ä¸çŸ¥å¾ä½•ä¸‹æ‰‹çš„æˆ‘ï¼Œæœå°‹äº†å¾ˆä¹…ï¼Œç™¼ç¾ä¼¼ä¹æ²’æœ‰å€‹å¾ˆå…¨é¢çš„æ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œéƒ½æ˜¯é›¶é›¶ç¢ç¢çš„ï¼Œæ–¼æ˜¯è¨˜éŒ„ä¸€ä¸‹ç›®å‰ç™¼ç¾çš„å¹¾å€‹reference</p>
<p><a href="http://thinkingtkinter.sourceforge.net/">http://thinkingtkinter.sourceforge.net/</a><br>

<p>å¤§æ¦‚è¦èŠ±ä¸€äº›æ™‚é–“ä¾†ç ”ç©¶ä¸€ä¸‹ï¼Œæ‰èƒ½æœ‰å¿ƒå¾—ã€‚<br>
ç¸½ä¹‹å°±å…ˆä¾†å€‹ç„¡èŠçš„hello worldå§ :-S<br>
å‰›å‰›ç™¼ç¾å…¶å¯¦pythonå®˜ç¶²æ–‡ä»¶å¥½åƒå°±å¾ˆä¸éŒ¯äº†ï¼Œå·²è£œä¸Šï¼Œç™¼ç¾ä»€éº¼çš„è©±ï¼Œæ­¤ç¯‡éš¨æ™‚æœƒæ›´æ–° :)</p>
<pre><code class="hljs language-python">	<span class="hljs-keyword">from</span> tkinter <span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> *  
	<span class="hljs-keyword">from</span> tkinter <span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> ttk  
	<span class="hljs-keyword">from</span> tkinter.ttk <span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> *  
	  
	<span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">main</span>():  
	   root = Tk()  
	   style = ttk.Style().configure(<span class="hljs-string">'TLabel'</span>, foreground=<span class="hljs-string">'black'</span>, background=<span class="hljs-string">'green'</span>)  
	   ttk.Label(root, text=<span class="hljs-string">'Hello World'</span>).grid()  
	   root.mainloop()  
	  
	<span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> __name__ == <span class="hljs-string">'__main__'</span>:  
	   main()  
</code></pre>
<p>å·²ç™¼ç¾ <a href="http://www.tcl.tk/man/tcl8.5/TkCmd/grid.htm">http://www.tcl.tk/man/tcl8.5/TkCmd/grid.htm</a> é€™æ˜¯tcl/tkçš„å®˜æ–¹æ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œå¾é€™è£¡å°±å¯ä»¥æŸ¥åˆ°ä½ æ‰€æœ‰æƒ³è¦çš„é—œæ–¼tkinterçš„referenceã€‚</p>
<p>#è¿½åŠ ç›®å‰ç‚ºæ­¢çš„å¿ƒå¾—ï¼Œå¾ç¶²è·¯ä¸Šå­¸äº†ä¸€äº›é—œæ–¼tkinterä½¿ç”¨åˆ°çš„åŸç†ï¼Œä¹Ÿç…§è‘—æ•™å­¸ï¼Œå¯«äº†ä¸€å€‹å˜—è©¦çš„codeï¼Œå¦‚ä¸‹</p>
<pre><code class="hljs language-python"><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span> tkinter <span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> *
<span class="hljs-keyword">from</span> tkinter <span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> ttk


<span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">main</span>():
    root = Tk()

    content = ttk.Frame(root, padding=(<span class="hljs-number">3</span>, <span class="hljs-number">3</span>, <span class="hljs-number">12</span>, <span class="hljs-number">12</span>))
    frame = ttk.Frame(
        content, borderwidth=<span class="hljs-number">7</span>, relief=<span class="hljs-string">'solid'</span>, width=<span class="hljs-number">200</span>, height=<span class="hljs-number">100</span>)
    namelbl = ttk.Label(content, text=<span class="hljs-string">'Name'</span>)
    name = ttk.Entry(content)

    onevar = BooleanVar()
    twovar = BooleanVar()
    threevar = BooleanVar()

    onevar.<span class="hljs-built_in">set</span>(<span class="hljs-literal">True</span>)
    twovar.<span class="hljs-built_in">set</span>(<span class="hljs-literal">False</span>)
    threevar.<span class="hljs-built_in">set</span>(<span class="hljs-literal">True</span>)

    one = ttk.Checkbutton(content, text=<span class="hljs-string">'one'</span>, variable=onevar, onvalue=<span class="hljs-literal">True</span>)
    two = ttk.Checkbutton(content, text=<span class="hljs-string">'two'</span>, variable=twovar, onvalue=<span class="hljs-literal">True</span>)
    three = ttk.Checkbutton(
        content, text=<span class="hljs-string">'three'</span>, variable=threevar, onvalue=<span class="hljs-literal">True</span>)

    ok = ttk.Button(content, text=<span class="hljs-string">'OK'</span>)
    cancel = ttk.Button(content, text=<span class="hljs-string">'Cancel'</span>)

    content.grid(column=<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, row=<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, sticky=(N, S, E, W))
    frame.grid(column=<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, row=<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, columnspan=<span class="hljs-number">3</span>, rowspan=<span class="hljs-number">2</span>, sticky=(N, S, E, W))
    namelbl.grid(column=<span class="hljs-number">3</span>, row=<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, columnspan=<span class="hljs-number">2</span>, sticky=(N, W), padx=<span class="hljs-number">5</span>)
    name.grid(column=<span class="hljs-number">3</span>, row=<span class="hljs-number">1</span>, columnspan=<span class="hljs-number">2</span>, sticky=(N, E, W), pady=<span class="hljs-number">5</span>, padx=<span class="hljs-number">5</span>)
        one.grid(column=<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, row=<span class="hljs-number">3</span>)  <span class="hljs-comment"># row=2 seems the same</span>
        two.grid(column=<span class="hljs-number">1</span>, row=<span class="hljs-number">3</span>)
        three.grid(column=<span class="hljs-number">2</span>, row=<span class="hljs-number">3</span>)
        ok.grid(column=<span class="hljs-number">3</span>, row=<span class="hljs-number">3</span>)
        cancel.grid(column=<span class="hljs-number">4</span>, row=<span class="hljs-number">3</span>)

        <span class="hljs-comment"># when the window resized, all widget will be resized, too</span>
        root.columnconfigure(<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, weight=<span class="hljs-number">1</span>)
        root.rowconfigure(<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, weight=<span class="hljs-number">1</span>)
        content.columnconfigure(<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, weight=<span class="hljs-number">3</span>)
        content.columnconfigure(<span class="hljs-number">1</span>, weight=<span class="hljs-number">3</span>)
        content.columnconfigure(<span class="hljs-number">2</span>, weight=<span class="hljs-number">3</span>)
        content.columnconfigure(<span class="hljs-number">3</span>, weight=<span class="hljs-number">1</span>)
        content.columnconfigure(<span class="hljs-number">4</span>, weight=<span class="hljs-number">1</span>)
        content.rowconfigure(<span class="hljs-number">1</span>, weight=<span class="hljs-number">1</span>)

        root.mainloop()

        <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> __name__ == <span class="hljs-string">'__main__'</span>:
            main()
</code></pre>
<p>å…¶å¯¦æœ‰ç¨å¾®å­¸éè¦–çª—ç¨‹å¼è¨­è¨ˆçš„æ‡‰è©²éƒ½çŸ¥é“ï¼Œé€™é¡çš„éƒ½è·‘ä¸æ‰æœ‰ä¸€å€‹ä¸»è¿´åœˆï¼Œæ˜¯ç”¨ä¾†è™•ç†event queueçš„ï¼Œå› æ­¤python tkinterä¹Ÿä¸ä¾‹å¤– root.mainloop()ï¼Œåˆ°ç›®å‰ç‚ºæ­¢ï¼Œè·Ÿæˆ‘ä»¥å‰ç”¨windows apiå¯«çš„æ¦‚å¿µæœ‰æ‰€ä¸åŒçš„æ˜¯ï¼Œtkinterä»–æœ‰æ‰€è¬‚çš„ geometry managementï¼Œæ˜¯ç”¨ä¾†è¨ˆç®—æ¯å€‹widgetè©²æ”¾ç½®çš„ä½ç½®ä»¥åŠå¤§å°ï¼Œgeometry management æœ‰ä¸‰ç¨®</p>
<ol>
<li>place</li>
<li>pack</li>
<li>grid</li>
</ol>
<p>å¾æˆ‘çœ‹éçš„æ•™å­¸ï¼Œpackæ˜¯æœ€æ—©æœ‰çš„ï¼Œå®ƒèªªåŠŸèƒ½å¼·å¤§(æ©é¢ ä½†æ˜¯æˆ‘ä¸çŸ¥é“å¼·åœ¨å“ªï¼Œplaceç›®å‰é‚„æ²’ç”¨æ‰€ä»¥ä¸æ¸…æ¥šï¼Œæœ€å¾Œgridæ˜¯å¾Œä¾†tkinteræ‰å‡ºç¾çš„ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯å®ƒä¸€å‡ºç¾å¾Œä¾†å¾ˆå¤šäººéƒ½ç”¨å®ƒï¼Œç”±æ­¤å¯è¦‹gridæ‡‰è©²æ˜¯æ¯”packå¥½ç”¨ï¼Œå› æ­¤æˆ‘çœ‹çš„æ•™å­¸ä¹Ÿæ˜¯ç”¨gridå±…å¤šï¼Œèªªç©¿gridé ‚å¤šåªæ˜¯æŠŠè¦–çª—åˆ†æˆrowå’Œcolumné€™æ¨£ï¼Œæ–¹æ–¹æ ¼æ ¼ï¼Œä¹‹å¾Œè¦å®šæ¯å€‹widgetæ‰€åœ¨çš„row, columnï¼Œä»¥åŠå®ƒæ‰€è·¨è¶Šçš„row, columnå€é–“(ex. columnspan)ï¼Œé€™æ¨£ç¨‹å¼åŸ·è¡Œå¾Œï¼Œå®ƒå°±æœƒè‡ªå‹•è¨ˆç®—æ¯å€‹widgetçš„ä½ç½®äº†~<br>
è‡³æ–¼columnconfigure and rowconfigureå‰‡æ˜¯ç”¨ä¾†window resizeçš„æ™‚å€™ï¼Œå®ƒæœƒè®“è£¡é¢çš„å…ƒä»¶ï¼Œä¾ç…§ä½ è¦å®šçš„weightå»æ”¾å¤§( ex. weight=1 =&gt; 1 pixel to 1 pixel,&nbsp; weight=3 =&gt; 1 pixel to 3 pixel)</p>f8:Tae7,<p>æœ€è¿‘åšäº†å°å°çš„æ¸¬è©¦ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨pythonçš„ctypesä¾†å¯¦åšwindows apiçš„data type</p>
<p>ex.1</p>
<pre><code class="hljs language-python">	typedef struct _CHAR_INFO {  
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; union{  
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; WCHAR UnicodeChar;  
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; CHAR AsciiChar;  
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; } Char;  
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; WORD Attributes;  
	} CHAR_INFO, *PCHAR_INFO;  
ç”¨ctypeså¯¦åšå¦‚ä¸‹å…ˆå°‡åç‚ºCharçš„unionå¯¦åšå‡ºä¾†  
  
	<span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">Char</span>(ctypes.<span class="hljs-type">Union</span>):  
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; _fields_ = [(<span class="hljs-string">"UnicodeChar"</span>,WCHAR),  
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; (<span class="hljs-string">"AsciiChar"</span>, CHAR)]  
	å†ä¾†å°‡CHAR_INFOæ•´å€‹structureå¯¦åšå‡ºä¾†  
  
	<span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">CHAR_INFO</span>(ctypes.Structure):  
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; _anonymous_ = (<span class="hljs-string">"Char"</span>,)  
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; _fields_ = [(<span class="hljs-string">"Char"</span>, Char),  
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; (<span class="hljs-string">"Attributes"</span>, WORD)]  
	PCHAR_INFO = ctypes.POINTER(CHAR_INFO)  
</code></pre>
<p>å™¹å™¹å™¹~mission complete<br>
ex.2</p>
<pre><code class="hljs language-python">	typedef struct _CONSOLE_CURSOR_INFO {  
	 DWORD dwSize;  
	 BOOL &nbsp;bVisible;  
	}CONSOLE_CURSOR_INFO, *PCONSOLE_CURSOR_INFO;  
		<span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">CONSOLE_CURSOR_INFO</span>(ctypes.Structure):  
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; _fields_ = [(<span class="hljs-string">'dwSize'</span>, DWORD),  
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; (<span class="hljs-string">'bVisible'</span>, BOOL)]&nbsp;
</code></pre>
<p>å…¶å¯¦ctypesé€™æ¨¡çµ„æŒºæ–¹ä¾¿çš„ï¼Œå¯ä»¥éš¨æ„çš„callç”¨Cå¯«å‡ºä¾†çš„dllæª”ï¼Œå¦‚æœåªæ˜¯æƒ³è¦ç”¨åˆ°ä¸€é»é»dllæª”ï¼Œæˆ‘æƒ³è‡ªå·±å¯«å°±å¥½äº†ï¼Œä¸éœ€è¦å»ç”¨åˆ°å…¶å®ƒæ¨¡çµ„ï¼Œåƒæ˜¯å¦‚æœä½ è¦å¤§é‡çš„ç”¨åˆ°windows apié‚£å°±æœæ–·ç”¨<a href="http://sourceforge.net/projects/pywin32/">pywin32</a>å§:)ï¼Œè£¡é¢å¯å¹«ä½ å¯«å¥½ä¸€å †çš„æ±è¥¿å‘¢ï¼Œç•¢ç«Ÿé€™å‹•ä½œå¯¦åœ¨æ˜¯å¾ˆæ©Ÿæ¢°å¼ï¼Œæœ‰åˆ¥äººå¹«ä½ ç¨®æ¨¹ï¼Œå°±å»ä¹˜æ¶¼å§ï¼Œè€Œä¸”å®ƒé‚„æœ‰å€‹ç‰¹åˆ¥çš„åœ°æ–¹æ˜¯ctypeå·²å¹«ä½ ç¹é–‹pythonçš„GILé™åˆ¶~é€™å€‹å°±ä¸å¤šè§£é‡‹äº†ï¼Œç•¢ç«Ÿæˆ‘ä¹Ÿæ²’å•¥ç¢°åˆ°ã€‚</p>
<p>ç•¶ç„¶ç”¨pythonå»CALLç”¨Cå¯«çš„dllä¹Ÿæœ‰å…¶ä»–ç›®çš„ï¼Œé€šå¸¸æ˜¯æ•ˆç‡å•é¡Œï¼ŒæŠŠæ•ˆç‡åƒç·Šçš„åœ°æ–¹çµ¦è¼ƒä½éšçš„èªè¨€å»å¯¦åšï¼Œç›®å‰çŸ¥é“æœ‰å€‹å«<a href="http://www.swig.org/">SWIG</a>ï¼Œå¯ä»¥å°‡å¾ˆå¤šèªè¨€é»åœ¨ä¸€èµ·ï¼Œå› ç‚ºå°å¼Ÿä¹Ÿæ²’ç”¨éæ‰€ä»¥ä¸æ•¢å¤šè¨€</p>fa:["åˆ»æ„ç·´ç¿’"]
f9:"$Wfa"
fb:Tc88,<p><a href="https://basicenglishspeaking.com/100-common-phrases-and-sentence-patterns/">https://basicenglishspeaking.com/100-common-phrases-and-sentence-patterns/</a></p><p>These phrases and patterns are said as basic units for you to make much more correct sentences in English.
Here is my unarranged <a href="id:D5154728-F35D-401B-BBDE-73551CCE5E30">Phrase book</a></p><p>deep learning is the key to English fluency
</p><p>Are you sure about/of/that
Are you used to/Did you use to
As far as: so far
As far as ... be concerned:
    in a particular person's opinion
    if we are discussing or thinking about a particular thing
</p><p>Be careful that/not to
But this doesnâ€™t mean that
By the way
Compared to
Don't ever = Never, ever: at any time
Do you agree that/with/to
Do you carry this in size = Do you have this size
Do you mind
Shouldn't we
Not ... until
as ... as: the man runs as fast as the rocket
so ... that
Help yourself to sth = to take some of what you want, without asking permission
ex. Please help yourself to some cake
How come your little sister is so angry? used to ask someone why or how something happened
How do you like your new apartment?
I bet he is home now
I canâ€™t say who did the best
I dare say he wonâ€™t come
I'd hate for sb/sth to do sth: you don't want something to happen
If it hadnâ€™t been for your help, my experiments would have failed.
If  there is one thing that  annoys me,  itâ€™s people who donâ€™t keep their promises.
as ... as possible (I can)
Iâ€™m calling to say goodbye to you. calling to v: explain what you do through phone calling
go for sth = choose something ex. I really go for chinese food right now
His address is on the tip of my tongue, wait a minute. This expression is used when you are sure that you know something, but somehow it doesnâ€™t quite come to you
It may surprise you, but Maggie refused my proposal.
Iâ€™ve had enough of your complaining.
I would rather stay than leave: prefer to do sth instead of bla
Now that I think about it, you are wise not to have accepted him
I ran to the station only to find that the train had left. only to find that xxx: used when find something bad happened
See that the door is locked before you leave: (see that) to make sure that someone does something or that something happens
Speaking of the movies, have you seen â€œThe Patriotâ€? : Mentioned to sth
The more ... the more
There is nothing adj as noun(Ving + O, O)
be better off: to have more money than you had in the past or to be in a better situation
We may as well have a try since itâ€™s worth doing. may as well: there is no reason not to do
What will become of my family if my father goes bankrupt. become of: to happen to; be the fate of
What do you mean by saying that?
What do you say: what do you think
What if: used to ask about something that could happen in the future, especially something bad
Whatâ€™s the point of arguing with her? = What's the use of arguing with her?
Whether it rains or not, weâ€™ll hold the sports meet.
Would you care for some tea? = Would you like to drine tea?
You are not to scribble on the wall. You are not allowed to V
You only have to call her in order to know whether she will come or not.
</p>fd:["å¯¦é©—ç”¨_ai_å¹«åŠ©å­¸ç¿’è‹±æ–‡"]
fc:"$Wfd"
fe:T58e,<p>Terrified of pain, she dreaded doctor's appointments. She missed dinner parties that required her to drive at night.
That moment when you realize you want to live life to the fullest. The second you understand that the only thing between you and your dreams is fear.
</p><p>here is the full fear list of the author
<a href="https://100dayswithoutfear.com/list">https://100dayswithoutfear.com/list</a></p><blockquote><p>The enemy of success is not failure, it's comfort
</p></blockquote><p>the tips of <span class="secret-link-container"><span class="secret-link">Setting Fears</span></span></p><p>I want to expand my comfort zone!
I put the notes about this challenge in <a href="/without_fear.tldr">without fear</a></p><h1 id="authors-day-1-accept-the-challenge">Author's Day 1 Accept the challenge</h1><p>  What's the challenge?
</p><p>  To face a different fear for 100 days in a row.
</p><p>  What are you afraid of?
  I'm afraid of not being able to complete the challenge, regret this project and fail.
  What I'm most afraid of is not being able to conquer my fears and keep living a limited lifestyle where control and comfort reigns.
</p><p>  How has this fear affected your life so far?
  Not being able to take on challenges led me to live a very controlled and safe life, with zero risk, but also, zero return.
</p><p>  How was the experience?
  I'll answer this question once the project is completed.

   æåˆ°æœ‹å‹çš„æœ‹å‹å¾€å¾€æœƒå¸¶ä¾†æ„å¤–çš„çµæœ~
</p><p>   ç¯©é¸äººè„ˆä¹Ÿæ˜¯å¾ˆé‡è¦çš„ä¸€ä»¶äº‹ï¼Œé€™å€‹å¤§æ¦‚å°±æ˜¯é“ç†æˆ‘éƒ½æ‡‚ï¼Œå°±æ˜¯ã€‚ã€‚ å¯¦éš›ä¸Šè¦æ€éº¼æŒ‘éƒ½æ˜¯çœ‹ä½ å•¦ã€‚ä¸éä½ æŒ‘å®Œå¾Œï¼Œä¹Ÿé–“æ¥ä»£è¡¨ä½ çš„äº¤å‹åœˆçš„ç¸®å°ã€‚
   æ›¸ä¸­ä¹Ÿå»ºè­°è¦æœ‰è‡ªå·±çš„â€œç§äººæ„›åº—â€åå–®ï¼Œç”¨æ–¼ä¸åŒé¡å‹çš„äº¤éš›å ´åˆã€‚ ä¸éé€™ç¨®æ„›åº—çš„ç­‰ç´šæœ€å¥½æ˜¯åˆ°è·Ÿè€é—†å·²ç¶“æœ‰é»äº¤æƒ…äº†~
   åƒæ˜¯æƒ³è¦å’Œæœ‹å‹èŠå¤©è¶…éç‡Ÿæ¥­æ™‚é–“ï¼Œé€™æ™‚å€™å°±å¾ˆæœ‰ç”¨äº†ã€‚
</p><h2 id="chapter-7">chapter 7</h2><p>   ä½œè€…æœ‰æåˆ° remote çš„æ–¹å¼ï¼Œå°è‡´æºé€šæ–¹å¼è·Ÿç›´æ¥è¦‹é¢çš„å½¢å¼æœ‰æ‰€å·®ç•°ã€‚ ä¸éä¸ä»£è¡¨æºé€šä¸é‡è¦äº†ã€‚
   æ›¸ä¸­æåˆ°40æ­²å¾Œçš„ç¶œåˆèƒ½åŠ›æœƒé«”ç¾åœ¨æ›¸å¯«èƒ½åŠ›ã€‚

   ä¸è¦è€äº†æ‰å¾Œæ‚”ç•¶åˆå¦‚æœæœ‰å­¸ä»€éº¼å°±å¥½äº† - é€™æ¨£çš„æƒ³æ³•

   é€™é»çš„ç¢ºæ˜¯æˆ‘æ‡‰è¦æ”¹å–„çš„éƒ¨åˆ†å§ã€‚ã€‚ ä¸éé€™ä¹Ÿä»£è¡¨è¦è±å¯Œä½ çš„äººç”Ÿï¼Ÿ

   ex. <a href="https://hastie.su.domains/ElemStatLearn/">https://hastie.su.domains/ElemStatLearn/</a></p><h2 id="chapter-1213">chapter 12&amp;13</h2><p>   æ›¸ä¸­æåˆ°å¦‚ä½•åšä¸€å€‹åƒåœ¾éƒµä»¶ç¯©é¸å™¨ï¼Œæ„å¤–çš„ç®—æœ‰è¶£~ <a href="https://paulgraham.com/spam.html">https://paulgraham.com/spam.html</a> ä¸éé€™é‚Šä¾ç„¶æœ‰ä¸å°‘ä¸€äº›é—œæ–¼çµ±è¨ˆç›¸é—œçš„çŸ¥è­˜ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥å…¶å¯¦æ²’æœ‰è®€å¾—å¾ˆæ‡‚ï¼

   pybrain

   æ¨è–¦ç³»çµ±

10b:T102f,<p>it's editor written by <a href="/blog/emacs_cheatsheet">emacs lisp</a> which has powerful functions.
</p><p>to see the release log for  M-x <code class="inline-code">view-emacs-news</code></p><p>selection: C-SPC (in emacs, it means to start mark). use arrow key to selection words.
kill-ring-save: <code class="inline-verbatim">M-w</code> put the selection into kill ring.
yank: <code class="inline-verbatim">C-y</code>  paste recent kill ring.
</p><h1 id="univeral-arguments">univeral arguments</h1><table><tbody><tr><td>C-u</td><td>Digit argument 4</td></tr><tr><td>C-u C-u</td><td>Digit argument 16</td></tr><tr><td>C-u C-u ...</td><td>Digit argument 4<sup>n</sup></td></tr><tr><td>M-0 to M-9</td><td>Digit argument 0 to 9</td></tr><tr><td>C-0 to C-9</td><td>Digit argument 0 to 9</td></tr><tr><td>C-M-0 to C-M-9</td><td>Digit argument 0 to 9</td></tr><tr><td>C--</td><td>Negative argument</td></tr><tr><td>M--</td><td>Negative argument</td></tr><tr><td>C-M--</td><td>Negative argument</td></tr></tbody></table><h1 id="from-spacemacs-to-your-custom-emacs">from <span class="secret-link-container"><span class="secret-link">Spacemacs</span></span> to your custom emacs</h1><p>  <a href="https://protesilaos.com/emacs/dotemacs#h:98d3abcc-f34e-4029-aabc-740f0b6421f8">https://protesilaos.com/emacs/dotemacs#h:98d3abcc-f34e-4029-aabc-740f0b6421f8</a>
  this guy writes a lot of customization for his own emacs config.
  Maybe, I can learn some usages from him.
</p><h1 id="10-specific-ways-to-improve-your-productivity-with-emacs">10 specific ways to improve your productivity with emacs</h1><p>  <a href="https://sites.google.com/site/steveyegge2/effective-emacs">https://sites.google.com/site/steveyegge2/effective-emacs</a></p><p>  Any unnecessary motions is wasted energy and yields sloppy results
  Emacs offers a fine-grained (dense) control
  The author says emacs eventually becomes like an extension of your body
</p><h1 id="emacs-run-in-docker">Emacs Run in <span class="secret-link-container"><span class="secret-link">Docker</span></span></h1><p>  to add the ip in the xhost's access control list
</p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-sh">open -a XQuartz
xhost + <span class="hljs-variable">$ip</span>
</code></pre><p>  <code class="inline-verbatim">following command should run in the shell of x11 (which is opened by Quartz)</code></p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-sh">ip=$(ifconfig en0 | grep inet | awk <span class="hljs-string">'$1=="inet" {print $2}'</span>)
docker run -ti --name emacs\
       -e DISPLAY=<span class="hljs-variable">$ip</span>:0\
       -e UNAME=<span class="hljs-string">"emacser"</span>\
       -e GNAME=<span class="hljs-string">"emacsers"</span>\
       -e UID=<span class="hljs-string">"1000"</span>\
       -e GID=<span class="hljs-string">"1000"</span>\
       -v /Users/jing/.spacemacs:/home/emacs/.spacemacs \
       -v /Users/jing/.emacs.d:/home/emacs/.emacs.d \
       -v /Users/jing/Desktop:/mnt/workspace \
       jare/emacs emacs
</code></pre><p>  However, this is still has some problem. Ex. the extension will not load when you run with gui mode. I don't know why.
</p><h1 id="net-utils-builtin-pakcage-have-some-interesting-implementations">net-utils (builtin pakcage) have some interesting implementations</h1><p>  For more detial, to see <code class="inline-verbatim">emacs/30.0.60/lisp/net/net-utils.el</code></p><h1 id="github-action">github action</h1><p>  <a href="https://github.com/marketplace/actions/set-up-emacs">https://github.com/marketplace/actions/set-up-emacs</a></p><h1 id="some-good-packages">some good packages</h1><ul><li><p><a href="https://github.com/DamienCassou/flycheck-hledger/blob/master/Makefile">https://github.com/DamienCassou/flycheck-hledger/blob/master/Makefile</a></p></li><li><p><span class="secret-link-container"><span class="secret-link">emacs-aio (async)</span></span></p></li><li><p><span class="secret-link-container"><span class="secret-link">emacs embark</span></span></p></li></ul><h1 id="emacs-lisp-api-faq"><span class="secret-link-container"><span class="secret-link">emacs lisp api faq</span></span></h1>10d:["org_roam_tip"]
10c:"$W10d"
10e:T48ee,<p>a dialect of <span class="secret-link-container"><span class="secret-link">lisp</span></span>
<a href="https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6492704/what-exactly-does-homoiconicity-mean">https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6492704/what-exactly-does-homoiconicity-mean</a>
a homoiconic language.
homoinoic means "code as data". the homo prefix stands for this characteristic.
</p><p>this is <span class="secret-link-container"><span class="secret-link">cheatsheet</span></span> for emacs lisp programming language syntax and semantic
the following notes are organized from <a href="http://caiorss.github.io/Emacs-Elisp-Programming/Elisp_Programming.html#sec-1-6-6">this website</a></p><p>a emacs cheatsheet website
<a href="https://alhassy.com/ElispCheatSheet/">https://alhassy.com/ElispCheatSheet/</a></p><h1 id="numberic-types">numberic types</h1><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-emacs-lisp">(+ 1 3) ; -&gt; 4
(+ 1.0 2) ; -&gt; 3.0
(/ 3 2) ; -&gt; 1

1e2 ; -&gt; 100
(+ 1 1000000000000000000000000000000000000000) ; -&gt; like python, it supports big num
</code></pre><h1 id="character-types">character types</h1><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-emacs-lisp">(string ?f ?o ?o) ; =&gt; "foo"
?A ; =&gt; 65 (#o101, #x41, ?A)
(format "I have %s bananas" 3) ; =&gt; "I have 3 bananas"
</code></pre><h1 id="lists">lists</h1><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">(equal '(1 2 3 4 5) (list 1 2 3 4 5)) ;; both are the same
</code></pre><h1 id="string-vs-symbol">string vs symbol</h1><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">'this-is-a-symbol ;;
"this-is-a-string" ;;
</code></pre><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-emacs-lisp">(string= "a" "a") ; =&gt; t check string and equality
(string= "a" 'a) ; =&gt; t
</code></pre><h1 id="basic-types-predicate">Basic types predicate</h1><p>  there is no false in emacs lisp, everything is evaluated to be nil will be thought as false
</p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">(print (null nil))
(print (numberp 2))
(print (numberp "2"))
(print (atom nil))
</code></pre><pre class="fixed-width">t

t

nil

t</pre><p></p><h1 id="get-object-type">Get Object Type</h1><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">(type-of (current-buffer))
</code></pre><pre class="fixed-width">buffer</pre><p></p><h1 id="defvar-vs-setq-defcustom">defvar vs setq, defcustom</h1><p>  They both are nearly the same except for <code class="inline-code">defvar</code> will not overwrite the origin definition if the variable-name is already be defined.
</p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">(defvar var-name value "doc")
(setq var-name value)
</code></pre><p>  Defcustom provide a more user-friendly customization with the built-in function <code class="inline-verbatim">customize</code>.
</p><h1 id="non-destructive">non destructive</h1><p>  ex.
  reverse vs nreverse
  append vs nconc
  remove vs delete
</p><p>  but the â€œnâ€ in this context stands for â€œnon-consingâ€
</p><h1 id="progn-vs-cl-block">progn vs cl-block</h1><p>  they are almost the same. cl-block can name the block
  ex.
</p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-emacs-lisp">(cl-block yo
  (print "hello")
  (print "world"))

(progn
  (print "hello")
  (print "world"))
</code></pre><h1 id="optional-arguements">optional arguements</h1><p>  Every arguement that follows the <code class="inline-code">&amp;optional</code> keyword is optional.
</p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">(defun hi(&amp;optional msg1) ...BODY)
</code></pre><h1 id="set-vs-setf-vs-setq-vs-setq-default">set vs setf vs setq vs setq-default</h1><p>  Setq-default is globally set a variable( which is the default for buffer variable).
</p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-emacs-lisp">(set ls '(1 2 3 4)) =&gt; Error - ls has no value
(set 'ls '(1 2 3 4)) =&gt; OK
(setq ls '(1 2 3 4)) =&gt; OK - make ls to (quote ls) and then have the usual set
(setf ls '(1 2 3 4)) =&gt; OK - same as setq so far BUT
(setf (car ls) 10) =&gt; Makes ls '(10 2 3 4) - not duplicated by setq/set
</code></pre><h1 id="associative-list">associative list</h1><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-emacs-lisp">(setq a '(("yo" . 20) ("bea" . 10))
</code></pre><h2 id="assoc-assq-alist-get">assoc, assq, alist-get</h2><p>   retrieve the pair by <code class="inline-verbatim">assq</code> and it use <code class="inline-verbatim">eq</code> to compare the equality of elements
</p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-emacs-lisp">(assq "yo" a)
</code></pre><p>   <code class="inline-verbatim">assoc</code> allows you to custom the comparison function
</p><p>   <code class="inline-verbatim">alist-get</code> is very similar to assoc but more powerful. it can do things like get with fallback to default value and pop the element
</p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-emacs-lisp">(setq foo '((a . 1) (b . 2)))
(setf (alist-get 'b foo nil 'remove) nil)
</code></pre><h1 id="hash-table">hash table</h1><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-emacs-lisp">(setq xx (make-hash-table :test 'equal))
(puthash 'key 10 xx)
(gethash "key" xx) ;; 10
(remhash 'key xx)
</code></pre><h2 id="get-the-values-of-hash-tables">get the values of hash tables</h2><p>   like python's dict.values()
</p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-emacs-lisp">(map-values xx)
</code></pre><h1 id="anonymous-function--lambda-functions">anonymous function / lambda functions</h1><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">(defvar add3 (lambda (x) (+ x 3))) ;; we can use setq to replace
(funcall add3 10) ;; will output 13
</code></pre><p>  Anonymous function is different from the function. We can use <code class="inline-code">type-of</code> to see the type of anonymous but funcitons not.
</p><p>  There is a <code class="inline-code">setf</code> to set symbol-function so <code class="inline-code">defun</code> actually equals to
</p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">(setf (symbol-function 'add2)
      #' (lambda (x) (+ x 2)))
</code></pre><p>  the name of a function needs to be of type
</p><h1 id="passing-functions-as-arguments">passing functions as arguments</h1><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">(far #'func1 #'func2 x) ;; this is how to pass function as arguements
(defun far (func1 func2 x)
  (+ (funcall fucn1 x) (funcall func2 x))) ;; this is the definition
</code></pre><p>  I don't know why need to use this format
</p><h1 id="variadic-functions-and-optional-arguements">variadic functions and optional arguements</h1><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">(defun sum (&amp;rest nums) ;; variadic arguements
  (apply #'+ nums))
(sum 1 2 3) ;; call sum with arbitrary arguements
</code></pre><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">(defun gen-list (a &amp;optional b)
  (list a b))
(gen-list 1)
</code></pre><table><tbody><tr><td>1</td><td>nil</td></tr></tbody></table><p>  wow, it has keyword arguments like python..
</p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">(defun make-shell-interface (&amp;rest params)
  ((let ((name (plist-get params :name))
         (type (plist-get params :type)))
     (...))))
</code></pre><h1 id="emacs-lisp-doesnt-support-closure-by-default">emacs lisp doesn't support closure by default</h1><p>  That's because emacs use dynamic binging by default. However, you can use <code class="inline-code">(setq lexical-binding t)</code> to enable lexical binding
  to support the closure
</p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">(defun make-adder (n)
  #'(lambda (x)
      (+ x n)))

(setf add2 (make-adder 2))
(funcall add2 3) ;; this will fail
</code></pre><h1 id="local-variables">local variables</h1><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-emacs-lisp">(let ((curr (point))
      (start-pos 0)
      )
  ;; some-body
  (message "hi"))
</code></pre><h1 id="if-let">if-let</h1><p>  <a href="/blog/rust">Rust</a> has the similar stuff.
</p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-emacs-lisp">(if-let ((name nil))
    (message "yo")
  (message "no"))
</code></pre><h1 id="symbol">symbol</h1><p>  One of the more confusing parts of Elispâ€™s is that its symbols point to multiple storage locations;
  a single symbol can refer to both a <code class="inline-verbatim">function</code> and a <code class="inline-verbatim">variable</code></p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-emacs-lisp">(setq baz 123)
(defun baz (x y)
  (- x y))

(message "baz as value: %s" baz) ; =&gt; "baz as value: 123"
(baz 10 3) ; =&gt; 7
</code></pre><h1 id="symbol-to-string">symbol to string</h1><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">(symbol-name 'hi) ;; will output hi because we 'hi is a symbol
</code></pre><h1 id="closures">closures</h1><p>  <a href="http://caiorss.github.io/Emacs-Elisp-Programming/Elisp_Programming.html#sec-1-6-7">http://caiorss.github.io/Emacs-Elisp-Programming/Elisp_Programming.html#sec-1-6-7</a></p><p>  By default, emacs lisp is dynamic binding so it does not support closure.
</p><p>  how to enable lexical binding in the org babel
  <a href="https://emacs.stackexchange.com/questions/61754/how-can-i-enable-lexical-binding-for-elisp-code-in-org-mode">https://emacs.stackexchange.com/questions/61754/how-can-i-enable-lexical-binding-for-elisp-code-in-org-mode</a></p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-emacs-lisp">(defun adder (a)
  (lambda (b) (+ a b)))
</code></pre><pre class="fixed-width">adder</pre><p></p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-emacs-lisp">(funcall (adder 5) 3) ;; this will not work
</code></pre><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-emacs-lisp">(setq lexical-binding t)
;; this will not works for the org babel mode
;; the only way is set the correspond header
(defun adderx (a)
  (lambda (b) (+ a b)))

(funcall (adderx 3) 4)
</code></pre><pre class="fixed-width">7</pre><p>
  in ielm, this will work. I don't know why it broken at the org babel.
</p><h1 id="defstruct">defstruct</h1><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">(defstruct user id name balance) ;; this will implicitily define
;; make-user, user-p, copy-user
;; It's obviously defstruct is a kind of macro
</code></pre><h1 id="quasiquote">quasiquote</h1><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">`("1+1=" ,(+ 1 1)) ;; you will get ("1+1=" 2)
</code></pre><table><tbody><tr><td>1+1=</td><td>2</td></tr></tbody></table><p>  let's see how ,@ works
</p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">`(+ 1 2 3 ,@(list 1 2))
</code></pre><table><tbody><tr><td>+</td><td>1</td><td>2</td><td>3</td><td>1</td><td>2</td></tr></tbody></table><h1 id="advice-vs-hook">Advice vs Hook</h1><p>  <a href="https://www.emacswiki.org/emacs/AdviceVsHooks">https://www.emacswiki.org/emacs/AdviceVsHooks</a></p><h1 id="interactive-function">interactive function</h1><p>  it means you can search and execute your function by execute-extended-command
</p><p>  To make this work you need to add <code class="inline-code">(interactive)</code></p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">(defun hi ()
  (interactive)
  (message "hi"))
</code></pre><h2 id="pass-a-list-in-interactive">pass a list in interactive</h2><p>   it will pass the list of args to the function
</p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">(defun ha (obj)
  (interactive (list "hi"))
  (message obj))
</code></pre><h1 id="predicate-methods-means-assertion-method">predicate methods means assertion method</h1><p>  ex. isEmpty. In emacs lisp, use suffix `p` in convention
  ex. <code class="inline-code">is_empty -&gt; empty-p</code></p><p>  #' (sharp quote) , which will warns you if the function is undefined.
  (provide 'foo) works like module.export in javascript
  use require to load library.
</p><p>  what the fuck is ###autoload doing?
</p><h1 id="pred">pred</h1><p>  only works in pcase macro
  pred is a built-in function that takes a predicate function as an argument and returns a new function that applies the predicate to its argument.
</p><p>  A predicate function is a function that returns a boolean value (t or nil) depending on whether some condition is true or false. For example, integerp and stringp are predicate functions that return t if their argument is an integer or a string, respectively.
</p><p>  When pred is used in conjunction with pcase, it allows you to apply a predicate function to a value and check if the result is true. Here's an example:
</p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-emacs-lisp">(pcase '("hello" 42)
  (`(,(pred stringp) ,(pred integerp))
   (message "string followed by an integer")))
</code></pre><h1 id="pcase-let">pcase-let</h1><p>  it works like a pattern matching and python's assignment unpacking
</p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-emacs-lisp">(pcase-let ((`(1 2 ,foo) '(3 4 10)))
  (message "foo = %s" foo))
</code></pre><p>  pcase-lambda works samely but binding as a function
</p><h1 id="elisp-has-many-side-effect-functions">elisp has many side effect functions</h1><p>  I think (maybe it's not suitable with functional programming ?)
</p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-emacs-lisp">
(save-excursion &amp;rest BODY)
;; example
(save-excursion
  (beginning-of-line)
  (search-forward "\"" (point-at-eol)) ;; point-at-eol is the bound we want to search
  (1- (point)))

</code></pre><p>  save-excursion works like transaction any move cursor function will finally be reset to reset destination.
</p><h1 id="how-to-defined-a-macro">how to defined a macro</h1><p>  need to read the ansi common lisp
  often combine with <code class="inline-verbatim">quasiquote</code></p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">(defmacro rebindfun (new-name old-name)
  `(setf (symbol-function ,new-name) ,old-name)) ;; interesting usage
</code></pre><p>  This works like the built-in function <code class="inline-code">defalias</code></p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">(defalias 'filter 'remove-if-not)
</code></pre><p>  <code class="inline-verbatim">,@</code> will evaluate the express like <code class="inline-verbatim">,</code> but it accepts a list and expands it into the resulting list.
</p><h2 id="macro-expand">macro expand</h2><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">(macroexpand '(rebindfun 'abc 'message)
</code></pre><h1 id="emacs-lisp-api-faq"><span class="secret-link-container"><span class="secret-link">emacs lisp api faq</span></span></h1><h1 id="coding-style">Coding Style</h1><p>  coding style's <a href="https://github.com/bbatsov/emacs-lisp-style-guide">reference</a></p><h3 id="emacs-use-two-space-for-indentation-but-in-func-definition-not-always-be">emacs use two space for indentation but in func definition not always be</h3><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-emacs-lisp">(format "%s %d"
        something
        something-else)

</code></pre><p>    function body aligned with arguements
</p><h3 id="function-indentation-style">function indentation style</h3><p>    place all trailing parentheses on a single line instead of distinct lines.
</p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">(let ((x "20")
      (y "30"))
  sayhi "x"
  )
</code></pre><p>    if any text precedes an opening bracket ( { [ or follows an closing bracket ]}),
    separate that text from the bracket with a space.
</p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">(foo (bar baz) hi)
</code></pre><h3 id="use-unless-is-more-authenticer">use unless is more authenticer</h3><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">(when (not conds) () ()) == (unless () ())
</code></pre><p>    ok.. there is a small util function for something like (+ x 1) which can be
    written to (1+ x). However, I think (+1 x) will be more clearer
</p><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">(+ 1 2)
(1+ 2) ;; ok, I know why can not use (+1 x), it seems conflict ..
(1- 3)
</code></pre><pre class="fixed-width">8</pre><p></p><h3 id="whats-the-differnt-between-with-eval-after-load-and-eval-after-load">what's the differnt between `with-eval-after-load` and `eval-after-load`</h3><h3 id="some-naming-convention">some naming convention</h3><ul><li><p>function naming use `lisp-case` ex. get-backage instead of get<sub>backage</sub> or getBackage
</p></li><li><p>private top-level definition
</p></li><li><p>projectile--private-fun
</p></li></ul><h1 id="emacs-api">Emacs API</h1><table><tbody><tr><td>Terminology</td><td>Description</td></tr><tr><td>:---</td><td>:---</td></tr><tr><td>Point</td><td>cursor position, number of ch from the beginning of buffer</td></tr><tr><td>Buffer</td><td>Place where the user can edit the content</td></tr><tr><td>Mark</td><td>Beginning of the selected area</td></tr><tr><td>Region</td><td>Selected area/text</td></tr><tr><td>Frame</td><td>The current window of emacs</td></tr><tr><td>Fill</td><td>Wrod Wrap</td></tr><tr><td>Yank</td><td>Copy</td></tr><tr><td>Kill Region</td><td>Cut</td></tr><tr><td>Kill Ring</td><td>Clipboard</td></tr><tr><td>Kill Buffer</td><td>Close Buffer</td></tr><tr><td>Mode Line</td><td>Status Bar</td></tr><tr><td>Font Locking</td><td>Syntax Coloring</td></tr><tr><td>Narrowing</td><td>shows only part of the buffer (a contiguous block of text, hiding the rest)</td></tr></tbody></table><h3 id="example-get-selection">example get selection</h3><pre class="src-block"><code class="hljs language-elisp">(defun get-selection ()
  "Get the text selected in current buffer as string"
  (interactive)
  (buffer-substring-no-properties (region-beginning) (region-end))
  )
</code></pre><h1 id="reference">Reference</h1><p>  Actually, we can use info mode to read elisp. An interesting usage is that we can use <code class="inline-code">(info "(elisp) Symbols")</code> to show the documentation.
</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.emacswiki.org/emacs/WhyDoesElispSuck">why emacs lisp suck</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://wikemacs.org/wiki/Emacs_Lisp_Ressources">a great guide to learn emacs lisp</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://caiorss.github.io/Emacs-Elisp-Programming/Elisp_Programming.html#sec-3-6-2">a good tutorial about emacs lisp</a></p></li><li><p><a href="http://caiorss.github.io/Emacs-Elisp-Programming/Elisp_Programming.html#sec-3-9-2">a very good emacs example link</a></p></li><li><p><a href="https://emacsninja.com/posts/a-piece-of-advice.html">emacs ninja (a blogger)</a></p></li><li><p><a href="https://www.emacswiki.org/emacs/ElispCookbook">elisp cookbook</a></p></li></ul>110:["emacs"]

111:T7c0,<p>It is a <span class="secret-link-container"><span class="secret-link">git</span></span> extension that allows you to store sensitive information in a secure manner based on <span class="secret-link-container"><span class="secret-link">gpg</span></span> for encryption and decryption
</p><h1 id="installation">Installation</h1><p>  brew install git-secret
</p><h1 id="initialization">Initialization</h1><h2 id="git-secret-init">git secret init</h2><p>   initialize this git repository as a git secret repository
</p><h1 id="user-management">User management</h1><h2 id="git-secret-tell-user">git secret tell [user]</h2><p>   Specify the user whose GPG key will be used for encryption and decryption
   list the available user by running <code class="inline-verbatim">gpg --list-secret-keys</code></p><h2 id="git-secret-whoknows">git secret whoknows</h2><p>   list the users have permissions
</p><h1 id="encryption-and-decryption">Encryption and decryption</h1><h2 id="git-secret-add-filename">git secret add [filename..]</h2><p>   Add files to be encrypted and protected
   you need to perform git secret hide to delete the unencrypted files and create encrypted files.
</p><h2 id="git-secret-reveal">git secret reveal</h2><p>   Decrypt the encrypted files
</p><h2 id="git-secret-hide--d">git secret hide -d</h2><p>   Delete unencrypted files and create encrypted files.
</p><h2 id="git-secret-hide--m">git secret hide -m</h2><p>   Only encrypt files that have been modified
</p><h1 id="maintenance">Maintenance</h1><h2 id="git-secret-killperson-emails">git secret killperson &lt;emails&gt;</h2><p>  Revoke access to the encrypted data for the specified users
</p><h1 id="best-practices">Best Practices</h1><ul><li><p>Always run git secret hide after adding new files to be encrypted.
</p></li><li><p>Use git secret reveal to decrypt files only when necessary.
</p></li><li><p>Regularly review the users who have access to the encrypted data using git secret whoknows.
</p></li></ul>113:["manage_cloudflare_with_terraform_without_breaking_existing_settings"]

119:Tac3,<p>the tips for learning English with <span class="secret-link-container"><span class="secret-link">ChatGPT</span></span></p><p>part 1 <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6Wy88GXBwTE">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6Wy88GXBwTE</a></p><p>summary:
It can give you some learning tips &amp; methods. However, it can not provide the concreate examples and even practice with you as teacher "currently".
</p><p>part 2 <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vuBhc9w8C0k">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vuBhc9w8C0k</a></p><p>For the interview questions, it well performs and do a great job! Try to mock interviews with chatGPT
</p><p>part 3 <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kq6kohqbmyQ">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kq6kohqbmyQ</a></p><p>cool, you can ask to create tests for vocabulary or grammer.
</p><p>For speaking, you can install the chrome plugin: voice control for chatgpt
</p><p>to practice speaking, it's better to define the scope (like traveling, oral presentation exam, interview and etc.)
you can start from talking about food, traveling and TV shows. those are good scopes closed to everyone's life.
It's important to learn the collocation and phrases used by the native speaker when you take on one on one speaking course.
</p><p>the following are the recommended commands from the channel: <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UPh0iQbg4iU">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UPh0iQbg4iU</a></p><p>#1 è·Ÿ ChatGPT å°è©±ï¼š
Let's have a conversation about (food / traveling to the US / movies and TV shows) æ¯å€‹ä¸»é¡Œä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥æä¾›æ›´å¤šç´°ç¯€ï¼Œåƒæ˜¯ Italian food, French food / traveling to Los Angeles / the TV show Friends.
</p><p>#2 è®“ ChatGPT æ•´ç†ç”¨éçš„å–®å­—ã€å¥å‹ï¼š

</p><ol><li><p>collocations and phrases
</p></li><li><p>sentence patterns
</p></li></ol><p>#3 ç”¨ ChatGPT æ•´ç†ç¶²ç‹€å–®å­—æ³•ï¼š
Provide information for these words: suggest, discussion, collaboration
</p><ol><li><p>root or prefix
</p></li><li><p>part of speech
</p></li><li><p>stress
</p></li><li><p>synonyms
</p></li><li><p>collocations
</p></li><li><p>register
</p></li><li><p>example sentence (use spoken english)
</p></li></ol><p>another great source

</p><p>to learn grammer

</p><p>to learn vocabulary

  <a href="https://www.keybr.com/">https://www.keybr.com/</a>

</p><h1 id="refine-the-key-mapping">Refine the key mapping</h1><p>  these are my configurations <code class="inline-code">songa-experiment</code></p><p>  online configurator
  <a href="https://configure.zsa.io/moonlander/layouts/63XGE/latest/0">https://configure.zsa.io/moonlander/layouts/63XGE/latest/0</a>
  <a href="https://configure.zsa.io/moonlander/layouts/mmWGP/latest/0">https://configure.zsa.io/moonlander/layouts/mmWGP/latest/0</a> (newest)
</p><h2 id="layer-1----normal-typing">layer 1 -- normal typing</h2><ul><li><p>use command+space as caps lock
</p></li><li><p>add additional punctuation symbol to each number key
</p></li><li><p>rearrange layer switch keys to the right of the left half device, and vice versa
</p></li><li><p>change tap/hold layer 2 to backspace
</p></li><li><p>add backslash under the forward slash
</p></li></ul><h2 id="layer-2----punctuation-and-arrow-keys">layer 2 -- punctuation and arrow keys</h2><ul><li><p>change ~ to `
</p></li><li><p>add page up and page down
</p></li></ul><h2 id="layer-3----mouse-actions-and-window-operations-ex-show-all-application-windows">layer 3 -- mouse actions and window operations (ex. show all application windows)</h2><ul><li><p>adjust wheel scroll speed
</p></li><li><p>add expand all applications windows key (called mission control <code class="inline-code">^ up</code>)
</p></li><li><p>add expand all the same application's windows key (called application windows <code class="inline-code">^ down</code>)
</p></li><li><p>add switch workspace (left and right) <code class="inline-code">^ left</code>, <code class="inline-code">^ right</code></p></li><li><p>move all key related to media to layer 4
</p></li></ul><h2 id="layer-4----function-keys">layer 4 -- function keys?</h2><h1 id="reference">Reference</h1><p>  åˆ¥äººä½¿ç”¨çš„å¿ƒå¾—
  <a href="https://gist.github.com/danthegoodman/bde0fec679e2ae3e099725f62c15442e">https://gist.github.com/danthegoodman/bde0fec679e2ae3e099725f62c15442e</a></p><p>  é€™ç¯‡è¬›äº†ä¸å°‘ï¼Œé—œæ–¼äººé«”å·¥å­¸ï¼Œè©²æ€éº¼è¨­ç½®éµç›¤
  <a href="https://zellwk.com/blog/moonlander/">https://zellwk.com/blog/moonlander/</a></p>120:["åˆ»æ„ç·´ç¿’","ç·´ç¿’çš„å¿ƒå¢ƒ"]
11f:"$W120"
121:T464,<p><a href="https://github.com/kot-behemoth/awesome-org-roam">https://github.com/kot-behemoth/awesome-org-roam</a></p><h1 id="concept">Concept</h1><p>  org-roam it's a <a href="/blog/zettelkasten">zettelkasten</a>'s proof of concept in <a href="/blog/emacs">emacs</a> with <span class="secret-link-container"><span class="secret-link">org mode</span></span>.
</p><h1 id="lets-get-started">Let's get started</h1><p>  There is a basic introduction youtube of org-roam in the <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AyhPmypHDEw&amp;t=628s">System Crafters</a> channel
</p><p>  I've written some org-roam key binding in the `init.el`
</p><p>  <a href="https://blog.jethro.dev/posts/org_roam_v2/">https://blog.jethro.dev/posts/org_roam_v2/</a></p><p>  a similar software
  <a href="https://twitter.com/flowtelic">https://twitter.com/flowtelic</a>
  <a href="https://oremacs.com/2020/12/31/happy-new-year/">abo-abo's experiment on emacs org with zettelkasten</a></p><p>  a package enhanced org-roam flow
  <a href="https://github.com/Vidianos-Giannitsis/zetteldesk.el">https://github.com/Vidianos-Giannitsis/zetteldesk.el</a></p>123:["zettelkasten_card_and_blog_static_website_generator","zettelkasten"]
122:"$W123"

</p><h1 id="special-rule">special rule</h1><p>  è¦æ˜¯ y æˆ– w åœ¨ä¸­é–“çš„è©±ï¼Œå‰‡è¦è®Šæˆ i è·Ÿ u
</p><p>  æœ‰äº›å­—è©çš„æ‹¼æ³•è·Ÿå°ç£çš„ç™¼éŸ³ä¸åŒï¼Œå› ç‚ºæ‹¼éŸ³è¼¸å…¥æ³•çš„ç™¼éŸ³æ˜¯ä»¥ä¸­åœ‹çš„ç™¼éŸ³ç‚ºæº–ï¼Œ
  å°¤å…¶æ˜¯æŸäº›ç¬¬ä¸‰æ–¹å» å•†çš„æ‹¼éŸ³è¼¸å…¥æ³•æ›´ä¸æœƒå»ç®¡å°ç£çš„ç™¼éŸ³ã€‚Appleã€å¾®è»ŸåŸå» çš„æ‹¼éŸ³æ¯”è¼ƒä¸æœƒæœ‰é€™å€‹å•é¡Œï¼Œ
  ç¬¬ä¸‰æ–¹è¼¸å…¥æ³•çš„è©±è«‹å°‹æ‰¾æ”¯æ´å°ç£ç™¼éŸ³çš„è¼¸å…¥æ³•
</p><p>  ex.
  <a href="https://briian.com/9216/">RIME ä¸­å·éŸ»è¼¸å…¥æ³•å¼•æ“</a>ï¼ˆè‹±èªï¼š<span class="secret-link-container"><span class="secret-link">Rime Input Method</span></span> Engineï¼Œåˆç¨± Rime è¼¸å…¥æ³•)
  macå…§å»ºå°±æœ‰æ‹¼éŸ³è¼¸å…¥

  brew install --cask squirrel

  <a href="https://github.com/rime/rime-terra-pinyin/blob/master/terra_pinyin.schema.yaml">https://github.com/rime/rime-terra-pinyin/blob/master/terra_pinyin.schema.yaml</a></p><h1 id="reference">reference</h1><p>  <a href="https://kknews.cc/zh-tw/news/zknp93q.html">https://kknews.cc/zh-tw/news/zknp93q.html</a>

125:"$W126"
127:Te05,<p>a popular time management method
<a href="https://todoist.com/zh-TW/productivity-methods/pomodoro-technique">https://todoist.com/zh-TW/productivity-methods/pomodoro-technique</a></p><p>make you concentrate on your efforts instead of the time (I think it's a little bit like the labeling skill in <a href="/blog/urge_surfing_meditation">meditation</a>)
you will ignore it because you give it a tag.
</p><p>you can try the pomodoro techinique if you..
</p><ul><li><p>find little distractions often derail the whole workday
</p></li><li><p>consistently work past the point of optimal productivity
</p></li><li><p>have lots of open-ended work that could take unlimited amounts of time
</p></li><li><p>are overly optimistic when it comes to how much you can get done in a day
</p></li><li><p>enjoy gamified goal-setting
</p></li></ul><p>the core thought is
</p><ol><li><p>get a todo list and a timer
</p></li><li><p>set your timer for 25 minutes, and focus on a single task until the timer rings
</p></li><li><p>when your session ends, mark off one pomodoro and record what you completed
</p></li><li><p>then enjoy a five-minute break
</p></li><li><p>after four pomodoros, take a longer, more restorative 15-30 minute break
</p></li></ol><p>the 25 minutes is not the truth compelled to be followed. it can be changed.
</p><blockquote><p>For tasks that you've been putting off for one reason or another, 25 minutes might be too long. If you're feeling a lot of mental resistance, or you just can't get yourself to stay focused for 25 minutes, try a 15-, 10-, or even 5-minute pomodoro.
</p></blockquote><p>give your eys from the screen and brain a break when in the break stage.
</p><p>the good rule helps you to plan a pomodoro
</p><ol><li><p>break down complex project
   if a task requires more than four pomodoros, it needs to be divided into smaller, actionable steps.
</p></li><li><p>small tasks go together
   any tasks that will take less than one pomodoro should be combined with other simple tasks.
</p></li><li><p>once a pomodoro is set, it must ring
   the pomodoro is an indivisible unit of time and can not be broken.
</p></li></ol><p>the process underlying the pomodoro techinique consists of five stages
</p><ul><li><p>planning at the start of the day: to decide on the day's activities
</p></li><li><p>tracking throughout the day: to gather raw data on the effort expended and other metrics of interest
</p></li><li><p>recroding at the end of the day: to compile an archive of daily observations
</p></li><li><p>processing at the end of the day: to transform raw data into information
</p></li><li><p>visualizing at the end of the day: to present the information in a format that facilitates understanding and clarifies paths to improvement
</p></li></ul><p>a pomodoro can't be split up because it's atomic. it's considered void when you are interrupted by someone or something.
</p><p>record the interruption by which thing and remember to void the current pomodoro
the goal is to analyze and try your best to reduce the number of void pomodoros.
</p><p>note you can use the rest of your time for <span class="secret-link-container"><span class="secret-link">overlearning</span></span> or improving skills or scope of knowledge if you do finish your given task before the timer goes off.
</p><p>pomodoro helps mitigate the procrastination and build more consistent work habits.
because it helps you build and focus on the process not the final product (result) of your goal.
you will find you're near the goal with the time going if you complete the process bit by bit.
</p>129:["æ·¬éŠæˆ‘çš„pomodoro_side_project","é–‹å§‹å‹•æ‰‹å¯¦ä½œpomodoro_side_project","40æ­²ç²¾å½©äººç”Ÿæ‰é–‹å§‹","åŸå­æ™‚é–“","å¤§è…¦è¡æµª","çˆ²ä½•æˆ‘å€‘ç¸½æ˜¯æƒ³å¾—å¤ªå¤š_å»åšå¾—å¤ªå°‘","ç·´ç¿’çš„å¿ƒå¢ƒ","è¡Œå‹•è¤‡åˆ©","é–“æ­‡é«˜æ•ˆçš„ç•ªèŒ„å·¥ä½œæ³•","é †è‘—å¤§è…¦ç¿’æ€§æ‡¶äººä¹Ÿæœ‰é«˜ç¸¾æ•ˆ"]
128:"$W129"

</p><p>Actually, there will be some resources in the github repo named awesome-xxx. For example, awesome-rust will collect lots of resources about the rust programming language.
</p><p>here is the <span class="secret-link-container"><span class="secret-link">rust cheatsheet</span></span> and sometimes I do some problem solving to familiar with the rust lang on the <span class="secret-link-container"><span class="secret-link">exercism</span></span> platform
